snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron told Britain’s top newspaper editors that “the clock is ticking” on their pledge to adopt a new system of press regulation of their own devising.
abstract: British Prime Minister David Cameron tells country's top newspaper editors to make haste in adopting independent system of press regulation if they want to avoid demands by victims of phone hacking scandal and some lawmakers for regulatory system backed by parliamentary statute.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron told Britain’s top newspaper editors that “the clock is ticking” on their pledge to adopt a new system of press regulation of their own devising.

headline.seo: Cameron Urges Editors to Act Quickly on Regulation
headline.main: British Editors Urged to Set Up Regulator
headline.print_headline: British Editors Urged to Set Up Regulator

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
